page.title: 10Customs in New Galloway
page.content: The village still celebrates in great style, Hallowe'en when the majority of adults and children dress up and visit all the homes in the village. One is still expected to perform to earn one's Hallowe'en. Guy Fawkes' night is a communal evening when we all gather in one field and each family contributes broth, baked potatoes, sausages and, of course, fireworks. The children still go carol singing. Obviously, Harvest thanksgiving is very important. Gala week is held in July. After the crowning of the Queen, there is a week of sporting and entertaining activities culminating in the parade of decorated lorries.There are different displays each year and the procession is always headed by a pipe band.All proceeds from these festivities go to the Senior Citizens' Christmas dinner and summer outing.
